result.execSummary:
The defendant Damond M. Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Each count is concurrent with each other, and consecutive to any other time.

Probation may terminate early upon completion of all terms.
Each count concurrent.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Cooperate with the Department
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Pay restitution of $900 to Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Court ordered defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample surcharge WAIVED as the court finds fee is not appropriate in this case.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damond M. Watts

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: vacate judgment $900.00 ,payments was made thru DOC case was paid in full. vp
vacate judgment $568.15, payments was made thru DOC case was paid in full. vp
vacate judgment 90.00 ,payments was made thru DOC case was paid in full. vp

Defendant withdraws motion for Miranda hearing.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction-each count concurrent with each other, consecutive to any other time, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 12 months, each count concurrent with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Complete 50 hours community service
-Pay restitution of $900 to Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample surcharge waived as the court finds fee is not appropriate in this case.  
Probation may terminate early upon completion of all terms.  kmw

Defendant Damond M. Watts in court with attorney Michael A Verrilli.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an AMENDED INFORMATION.  
Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(b) , a class A  MISDEMEANOR.  
Count 2:  the court amended the charge to Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(b) , a class A  MISDEMEANOR.  
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  kmw
DE Motion to Suppress Statements.  kmw

Defendant Damond M. Watts in court with attorney Michael A. Verrilli.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damond M. Watts in court with attorney Michael A. Verrilli.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Lorch-MCSD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Arraignment scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damond M. Watts in court with attorney Michael A. Verrilli.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/14 @ 1:30pm
